title: National Parks of New York Harbor: Directions & Transportation
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Directions & Transportation             Directions          SITES IN AND AROUND MANHATTAN         National Parks in Manhattan and Westchester make up Manhattan Sites.  These parks are reachable by various forms of public transportation and by car.  Check with the individual parks for specific details.   Directions to: African Burial Ground | Castle Clinton | Federal Hall | Lower East Side Tenement Museum | Theodore Roosevelt Birthplace | General Grant | Hamilton Grange | St. Paul's Church          GOVERNORS ISLAND NATIONAL MONUMENT        Governors Island is open during the summer season. Ferry service departs from lower Manhattan at the Battery Maritime Building, adjacent to the Staten Island Ferry and from Brooklyn at Pier 6 located at the foot of Atlantic Avenue.   Directions to: Governors Island           STATUE OF LIBERTY NATIONAL MONUMENT (INCLUDING ELLIS ISLAND)       The Statue of Liberty is located on Liberty Island. The Immigration Museum is located on Ellis Island. These two separate islands are accessible by the same ferry. Directions to the ferry departure points in lower Manhattan and New Jersey are available below.   Directions to: Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island           GATEWAY NATIONAL RECREATION AREA       Gateway National Recreation Area consists of three units. Each one is reachable by various forms of public transportation and by car.   Directions to: Jamaica Bay Unit | Staten Island Unit | Sandy Hook Unit
